sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: A boolean (true/false) variable can be either true or false (see boolean type).
sections.text_content: A boolean (true/false) variable can be either true or false (see boolean type).
sections.mdown_content: A **boolean** (true/false) variable can be either **true** or **false** (see **boolean** type).

sections.title: Example
code:
var passed : boolean := true
        var mark : int
        for i : 1 .. 10
            get mark
            passed := passed and mark >= 60
        end for
        if passed = true then
            put "You passed all ten subjects"
        end if

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content: The line if passed=true then can be simplified to if passed then with no change to the meaning of the program.
sections.text_content: The line if passed=true then can be simplified to if passed then with no change to the meaning of the program.
sections.mdown_content: The line **if** _passed_=**true** **then** can be simplified to **if** _passed_ **then** with no change to the meaning of the program.
